en.title: Git – Lesson 5: Stash, Restore, Reset (Soft / Mixed / Hard)
en.subtitle: Deep understanding of Git undo and recovery commands with real rescue lab.
en.goal: After this lesson you will confidently recover deleted work, undo commits, revert file changes, and safely switch tasks using Git stash.

sections.title: Why These Commands Matter
sections.description: These commands act as your undo superpowers in Git.
points: reset → Undo commits safely or dangerously
sections.warning: These commands are powerful. Wrong usage can permanently delete data.

sections.title: git stash — Save Unfinished Work
sections.description: Stash temporarily stores your changes without committing.
commands: git stash push -m "WIP: login page UI"
sections.note: git stash pop = apply + delete | git stash apply = apply only

sections.title: git restore — Undo File Changes
sections.warning: Restore only affects files, not commits.

sections.title: git reset — Soft, Mixed and Hard
sections.warning: Hard reset permanently deletes all uncommitted changes.

sections.title: Mini Project — Undo & Rescue Lab
commands: git stash push -m "WIP: editing demo file"

sections.title: Troubleshooting & Recovery
points: Use git reflog to recover lost commits
Stash conflicts can be resolved like merge conflicts

sections.title: Interview Questions
points: Difference between soft, mixed and hard reset?
Difference between git restore and git reset?
What is git stash used for?
How to recover commit after hard reset?
Difference between stash apply and stash pop?

sections.title: Conclusion
sections.description: You now have full control over undo, recovery and safe task switching in Git.
